controller

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.Controller
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.util.EventListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TestController

    public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener

      • create

        public void create()
        Create the Topology creation panel

      • save

        public void save()
        save GUI nodes and links of the topology to a json file dialogue input box to take filename from user checks if the filename already exists and offer the user the option to overwrite it

      • load

        public void load()
        alert user that all changes that are not saved will be lost and offer the user the option to proceed load GUI nodes and links of the topology from a json file dialogue input box to take filename from user alert user if file does not exists

      • start

        public void start()
        Displays a view that prompts the user to enter information about the messages to be sent.

      • enter

        public void enter()
        Saves the values (message, number of messages, rate) into sharable variables and generates a random source and destination ID then creates the list of messages to be later sent.

      • run

        public void run()
         throws java.lang.NumberFormatException,
                java.lang.InterruptedException
        A mode of simulation where the messages are sent automatically without user intervention. It then calculates total number of messages and average hops then displays them to the user.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • clear

        public void clear()
           throws java.lang.NumberFormatException,
                  java.lang.InterruptedException
        A mode of simulation where the messages are sent automatically without user intervention. This function clear the path of message passing when user click "Clear".
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • step

        public void step()
          throws java.lang.NumberFormatException,
                 java.lang.InterruptedException
        Another mode of simulation where the messages travels from one node to another node and stops for the user to click on "Step" again.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • submit

        public void submit()
        Submit the topology created by the user to IGP

        Clear all GUI nodes and links components

      • generateDestinationId

        public int generateDestinationId(int srcId)
        Uses the srcId parameter to generate a destination ID that does not match the source ID.

        Returns:
        destination ID

      • curAndNextNodeId

        public void curAndNextNodeId(int currNodeId,
                             int nextNodeId,
                             int numPackets)
                      throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Receives IDs of current node and next node and finds their coordinates, then calls drawPacketSimulation() to simulate the packet moving through the network.
        Parameters:
        currNodeId - ID of current node
        nextNodeId - ID of node we heading to
        numPackets - current total of steps the message has travelled
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • checkUserInput

        public boolean checkUserInput()
        Parses user input and checks if Message is text and not integer. Checks if number of messages is an integer greater than 0 and if rate is an integer.
        Returns:
        true if input is proper and false if not
